intro: Onopordum acanthium, commonly known as goat's beard, is a perennial flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It features tall, spiny stems and large, soft, woolly leaves that are often covered in a dense layer of white hairs. The plant produces yellow to orange composite flowers that bloom in late summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It is well adapted to dry, rocky soils and can thrive in full sun. Due to its ornamental value and hardy nature, it is often cultivated in gardens and naturalized areas.
